Reviews.Title: “Second time at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tino643
Reviews.Content: Stay of 9 January 2012 to February 20, 2012, at 15 penthouse. This is our second stay at the Element. We are a couple with a child 2 ½ years. The tenants before us had not left the previous day and they were expelled in the morning of our arrival. We waited 3 hours to integrate our condo. We were disappointed to find our condo poorly cleaned when we arrived and were forced to redo the whole household to be comfortable. We have not had our welcome basket. Sylvia our maid did not clean our condo the first two weeks of our stay but after Damien superintendent of the situation, she did a good job. Compared to past years where we were at pH 14, there was not a lot of towels and we were only three people. No bath mat, one wash cloth and linen for bedding were stained and withers. We had to buy wine glasses as there were none. No flat plastic or glass leftover food which is not practical when we cook every day. By cons, public areas and grounds are well maintained, we enjoyed the beach monitoring. The past year anyone could use the chairs. This year, the guards made sure that people who used the chairs were many customers Element. Very disappointed maintains the pool compared to last year. Last year the employee who took care of the pool doing a great job. For observing the employee for six weeks this year, it was very bad job. What caused the water to the pool to be quite blurred for a week. Then one day they had to empty the pool with pomes and bring in tanker trucks to fill it! We did not appreciate having ant colonies throughout the kitchen and living room, or cockroaches we found in the laundry room. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, the concierge Damien dedication is greatly appreciated, it offers an efficient service in case of trouble and without him it would be difficult to have such a good service. I still recommend the place especially for families with children as the pool is well suited for them and the private beach. But I give as a three star rating overall.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Sault Ste. Marie, Michigan, United States
Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Scott S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week of February, 2012. I'm a little surprised about a bad review here I just read and am, frankly, skeptical of some things said. In any case, here is my experience. We went with another couple and rented a "penthouse." A penthouse unit includes a rooftop area with your own freestanding hot tub and sitting areas. It is very private and we enjoyed having the extra amenities there. In fact, I watched the sun come up several times with a cup of coffee in the hot tub. The unit was quite nice with two bedrooms and two baths. The kitchen area has a full size fridge, microwave, stove, and everything you would need. A trip to the Mega grocery store and we had snacks and the makings for breakfasts. A dishwasher and washer/dryer for clothes are also in each unit. There is a great balcony and wall to ceiling windows facing the water. There is a road between the hotel and the beach but it is more like a service road. It is not busy at all and quite safe even for kids to cross. It is made of paving stone and not very wide. We didn't really view it being there as a negative. This is not really a hotel. It is a condo property and all the units are privately owned and leased when the owners are not around. So, the furniture and decorating will vary from unit to unit, but I'm guessing they are all pretty nice. When we arrived late on a Friday night, we were given a welcome pack that includes a cellphone that you can use to call the concierge,Damien, at any time. Nice touch. We did call him with a couple questions and met with him the next day. He is very helpful and friendly and usually on property. I'm guessing that not all the condo-owners wish to rent their units so many units were not being used. There is no hustle and bustle that you would experience at a typical hotel and the overall experience is very personal as the help at the front desk quickly knows you and they are also very helpful. There is no in-house bar or restaurant, but there are so many options around you, including your own kitchen, that we did not find that to be a problem. The pool area is beautiful and we found it and the grounds to be well kept. I swam in the pool and found the temperature to be pleasant and the pool clean. The beach is interesting. With the entire width of the hotel, you have a private beach area right in the middle with lounge chairs. It was never busy and there was no problem of people saving seats with towels and that sort of thing. To the left and right of the private area were public beach areas. The one on the left seems to be a staging area for fishing and diving boats. We enjoyed watching the activity over there, but I can see where some people might not. The beach itself is quite nice and the comment someone else made about smell is not accurate. When you walk the beach, as we often did, you occasionally get a whiff of something that smells sulfur-like. You get this everywhere, even in front of the most expensive resorts further down the beach, but it is just an occasional whiff and not something to be concerned about. Speaking of walking on the beach, a 10-15 minute walk takes you down to the busy mega-resorts around Constitution Avenue. It's fun to walk down there, but with the thousands of people on the beach, it makes me appreciate the uncrowded, quiet area that Elements offers. A 5 minute walk down the beach takes you to Origenes Restaurant. This is slightly off the beach and is a great place. It is on Calle 38 and if you walk past the restaurant, it takes you closer to the 5th Avenue area. We found this to be a more desirable walk than directly from Elements. The first couple of blocks from Elements to 5th Avenue is probably safe, but looks a little sketchy and the girls weren't too comfortable with it. Speaking of that issue, cabs are always available from Elements and a quick ride for 50 pesos will have you in the heart of 5th Avenue. That's about $4.50 at current exchange. The rate seems to vary a bit from cab to cab, so it doesn't hurt to ask before you close the doors and take off. We found that if we caught a cab from 5th Avenue back to the hotel and offered 50 pesos, they were generally happy with that. The wireless internet at the hotel did not work for our iPads. Damien recognizes that they have a wifi issue and said it is one of his main goals to get addressed in the coming months. We soon learned that the beach club a few hundred yards away had wifi and went and had a few beers and got the password information. So, I would walk over there once or twice a day to check my email. Speaking of the beach club, it is right next to the public beach I spoke of earlier. It is three levels high with a restaurant and bar service. The food was quite good and you can order food while you sit on a lounge chair taking in the sun with a cocktail. Great place to people watch and the locals like it too. So, we really enjoyed Elements and would go back. Next time I would like to stay longer! This is a great part of the world to vacation and Elements is a very relaxing place to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Bad "welcome"”
Reviews.Author: diannelg56
Reviews.Content: After viewing hundreds of condo rentals in the Puerto Morelos-Playa del Carmen area, we chose the Elements, as it looked great from the pictures, the reviews were good, and the booking process was easy. Also we felt that the rates were reasonable. I have to say that it is a beautiful building, the way it is designed. But we had a very bad welcome to the place. Being tired after flying all day from Washington State, enduring and ignoring the harassment near the taxi exit at the Cancun airport, we found that it was pouring rain. We had arranged taxi service ahead of time, so that worked out well. But it went downhill from there. This was Saturday evening, the day before the Super Bowl. When we arrived at the Elements, there was only one security guy at the front desk, and he did not speak English. He did have an envelope that had been prepared for us, so first he put those paper bracelets on our wrists, putting my husband's on way too tight, then took us to our condo, #118. He showed us the keys in the envelope and the security codes, then started to leave us there. My husband kept asking him to get another wristband, as his was uncomfortable. It took several charades-type sessions to get the message across. Finally he got the message, left, and returned with a new wristband. So we're standing there, not sure what to do because nothing had been properly explained to us. The envelope had Damien's number on it, but we couldn't get the phone to work. We tried walking to the beach club that we knew was next door, but it was dark and already closed. This was only about 7 or 8 in the evening. Then we tried to get back into the condo via a side door. The security code on the envelope for the side door didn't work. We went around to the front of the building and got a cab downtown to get some dinner. Coming back from town, by the way, a lot of cab drivers have never heard of the Elements, so you have to know the address! Anyway, we get back to the condo and find out there's no hot water! I tried the cell phone again, still didn't work, so I called the "front desk" on the phone that was on the kitchen counter. A guy answered in Spanish, I told him #118 no agua caliente, and he told me "manana"!!!! So the next morning, Sunday, we couldn't shower, and the cell phone still didn't work. My husband went down to the "front desk" (what a joke) and got them to call Damien. He said, oh, the breaker must have tripped, and told my husband where to find it. Sure enough, that was it. Couldn't someone have fixed that right away? We didn't get showers until that afternoon. Finally after another call from my husband, Damien came to the condo to show us some of the things we needed to know. One of the shower drains was plugged, and the kitchen faucet was loose. He did get those things fixed on Monday morning. We felt that the advertising for the place was a little misleading. There was a beach club called the Royal Caribe, I believe, next door, although it seemed to close rather early in the evening. But the "beach club" in front of the condo building was nothing more than a square of roped off sand with some lounge chairs on it and a few palm trees. There was no food or drink service. One day I was walking through it to get back to the condo from the beach, and I got stopped by security, which I thought was rude, since I was obviously wearing their wristband. The little street between the "beach club" and the condo grounds was always flooded with water. You always had to walk around a big puddle. And cars were allowed to drive and park there, so that kind of ruined the ambiance. The pool was very nice, the first day. As the week wore on the water got more and more murky. Saturday when we left, you couldnt see the bottom anymore and it had a slight green tinge. "Workers" (I use that term loosely) were there every morning tending to the pool and lawn, but they spent a lot more time standing around and visiting than doing any actual work. I watched a guy spend 10 minutes mowing the same 10 by 10 foot area of grass. And it wasn't even long enough to mow. I think he was enjoying the "view" at the pool. We finally discovered that the only way to get the cell phone to work was to go down on the ground, out of the building. The only way I could get internet service was to hang my Ipad over the railing of our balcony, and that only worked a few times. We tried using the internet in the business center, but that didn't always work either. Very frustrating! One of our last days we mentioned to Damien that the security code for the side doors didn't work, and he said, oh, you're not supposed to use that code! You use the "beach access" code! The "side door" code was only for 2 private condos! Well, how stupid of us! Why did they even give us that code if it didn't apply to us?? The elevator to our condo quit working halfway into the week, so we started taking the stairs, afraid of getting stuck! The beach was nice, if you don't mind the smell of sewage. And the Royal Caribe had some good food and drink. However, on Thursday, all day long, they played extremely loud techno music, which made it impossible to enjoy any time on our balcony. I believe Thursday was "ladies night" but it lasted all day! In spite of all the problems at the hotel, we still did have a lovely time. The weather was actually very good after that rain the first day. We snorkeled in Puerto Morelos, took many trips to 5th Avenue, went to Rio Secreto, and parasailed twice, just off the beach by the condo. By the way, the action of 5th avenue is quite a walk from the hotel, and part of the walk is through a kind of sketchy area. We usually took a cab. I do want to mention that our mad, MariCarmen, was very good. She was so sweet. I didn't understand everything she said but she seemed to understand my very broken Spanish. I don't think I would recommend this place. The condo was nice enough, although the couch in the living room was extremely uncomfortable. But we had such a bad welcome that it soured us on the place. Communication there leaves a lot to be desired. If we return to this area we will definitely stay elsewhere, maybe where the beach doesn't stink.

Reviews.Title: “The comforts of home.”
Reviews.Author: Satoriguy
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stayed for 4 nights in February 2012. We had unit 223 which was on the end and faced the ocean. Friends of ours had units over the pool and they all faced the ocean as also but we found they lacked some privacy. I would recommend anything on the second floor or above. We found the place very clean, and well maintained. The staff were very attentive and polite. If you are looking for the comforts of home in a tropical land, then this would be just like renting an apartment. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the elements!!”
Reviews.Author: v_karyna
Reviews.Content: After doing my research when planning my trip we chose Elements. I would definitely recommend it. The furniture is new, flat screen tv’s, the kitchen is fully equipped. It is not far from 5th Ave also close to the local grocery store Mega which is cheaper then Wal-Mart. We loved all the people that worked there very friendly. We went for the 4 of July week and we had a great time. It was so close to Xcaret and Xplor like a 10 min drive. Definitely recommend going to both parks. The beach was great you can actually go swimming not like in Cancun. We stayed in Cancun the last 2 days of our trip but could never go swimming since the red flag was always up. In Playa del Carmen the waves are not strong so you can actually enjoy the beach. I loved getting the messages they offer there in Elements which is really cheap just $30 or 35 not sure but really nice ladies. If you do decide to get a message I recommend you go reserve the time you want to go before. I would recommend Elements any time and will stay there on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Second time staying here love it!”
Reviews.Author: orthodon1
Reviews.Content: This was the second time my wife and I have stayed in this immaculate unit. Flat screen tv's, HBO, juice maker. This is one of the few condos at the Elements that has sliding screen doors and a balcony off each bedroom. With the ocean breeze we could open the doors all day and night, leave the AC off, listen to the waves and smell the fresh air. Damien and BRIC took good care of us. Como Como on 5th Ave. and 40th street is the best an only a 5 minute walk from the condo. You must have a reservation because it is popular every night and it has maybe 15 tables. Wide selection on the menu and great prices on wine. Damien will help get you the reservations. Get a 90 minute massage at the Elements beach club for about $25-30. Nice ladies who give a great massage under a canopy and the ocean breeze. When not on the beach we spendt a lot of time on the condo balcony. It is nicely furnished and has great views. Maybe it was the drinks but 2-3 hours every evening was how we spendt the time after the beach and before we went out for dinner. Hamburgers at Fogon across from Como Como were also a nice suprise.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: Tino643
Reviews.Content: We are a couple with one child a year and a half. We rented a penthouse apartment for six weeks from early January. When we arrived, we asked that we make a grocery store. It was made but it was not ours. There was a mixture between two condos. Damien, however, the concierge was quick to go do one. The service is very good with him. Those who replaces him when he is on leave does not do much. In terms of cleanliness, the site is very well maintained. Regarding the condo, even if it is almost new, maintains the interior is poor. In our bathroom, he began having ay moisisure the ceiling and painting began to be worn. The pool is very clean and cleaned daily. The private beach also. However it lacks oversight for the beach and pool. People from outside enjoy the sun and pool. Nobody expelled. The beach is beautiful but there is a strong odor of sewage. We were told there was a problem with the sewer pipes that go into the sea That does not taste to swim ... In terms of tranquility, a place is fairly quiet. But the condos are not well soundproofed, so you hear exactly what is happening in the bedroom of your neighbors .... Three times in six weeks we have advised the neighbors down he was doing too much noise. Six young people had rented a vacation condo and celebrated until 5:00 am .... In summary this is a great place for those with children. The pool and private beach was a plus. But it is a place that will not go very nice time. The owner of the condos do not seem to care for the inside to maintain that they are beautiful ....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beach hotely”
Reviews.Author: Thumpa
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice beach hotel with an incredible pool, then you should consider the Elements. It is an easy 10 minute walk to the official start of 5th Av. You can reach it either by the beach or walking up to 5th av and down the street. This hotel is in the north end of 5th Ave. The Cuban Grill has authentic Cuban music. The Mayan restaurant down the street was very good. 5th Av. restaurants can be very spendy so be careful on prices. The drink prices are the ones to spot. Another good place was Robert Gray's resturant.

Reviews.Title: “The Elements Garden House 2 - ELGH2”
Reviews.Author: zanidoo
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at The Elements very much. My wife and I traveled with our 2 year old son and girls 12 and 16. My wife and the girls enjoyed the shopping on 5th Avenue, which is a short walk. We couldn't keep the baby away from the uniquely designed pool, which is large and much of it is shallow enough for the baby to enjoy. Actually, we were nervous that The Elements was too far from the action at first, but in the end we all agreed that the location was great (quieter than something right on 5th Avenue, but still close enough to enjoy the action). Someone else noted the sulfur smell on the beach from time to time, and this was really our only compliant. However, we noticed the same smell elsewhere on the beach so I suppose this is a complaint more about Playa generally than The Elements. Generally, Damien, the concierge, and the other staff are great. Usually, the pictures on these websites are not accurate, but the pictures on here are dead on. The buildings and pool are well designed, the units are a good size, the bedrooms are nice, the furnishings are modern and sparse but more than adequate, the private beach is right there, etc. If we return to Playa we would certainly rent at The Elements again.

Reviews.Title: “The best of Playa”
Reviews.Author: bcoulter9912
Reviews.Content: Anyone looking for a great family vacation this is the place. We traveled for our 25th anniversary with 2 kids in late teens. The Elements is a beautiful, clean, well maintained resort. Damien at the front desk is a gem. Ask his advise on anything and he has a recommendation or a way to get it done for you cheaper and more efficiently than you can yourself. The beach club in front of the hotel is alittle pricey but fun to go to for a drink and some tunes. Martha is a great waitress there. Damien recommended Mexico Blue Divers. My husband and I are advanced divers but our kids had just been certified this summer. Blue diver customized 4 days of diving to suit all our skill levels. I ( a claustrophobic baby) highly reccomend the Cenotes. It is nothing like you will ever experience on any ocean dive. I loved it. The massage at the Elements is to die for and at 30 USD it is a steal. The people are friendly the sun shines every day and the water is blue. Go have fun :)

Reviews.Title: “Elements Playa Del Carmen Condo”
Reviews.Author: Rocstar27
Reviews.Content: I searched out a nice, quiet vacation destination to rest after completing my 6th Ironman Competition in August of 2010. I booked condominium #112 at the Elements in Playa Del Carmen for a full weeks stay. The accomodations were better than expected. The unit consists of 2 bedrooms and two baths, a large dining space, kitchen and living room. The view from the room is spectacular as you look over the largest pool in Playa Del Carmen right towards the perfect beach and ocean views. Being just 2 blocks from 5th Street, we had access to dozens of restaurants, coffee shops and stores. This was my 3rd trip to Mexico and definitely the best experience that I've ever had. So looking forward to further stays at The Elements.

Reviews.Title: “The Elements PH24 - AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: KMA2x
Reviews.Content: First let me say the Damien at the front desk is AWESOME!!!!!! This was my first trip to The Elements and I can't rate this place high enough. My best friend and i went to celebrate my divorce and this could not have been a better location. Since we traveled in August it was perfect, we were in low season had the pool pretty much to ourselves and the Penthouse was just as described - AWESOME. Let me say again that Damien made the trip enjoyable and was helpful and friendly. This place at this time was perfect for a kickback vacation when we spent the days in the pool/spa or laying on the balcony, cooking dinner or going out for a bite to eat. Everything is local and within minutes by cab or walking. Our stay was for 8 days and there is No doubt that we will be back,

Reviews.Title: “High qualitly Condo”
Reviews.Author: OrkunP
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week. Penthouses are realy nice. Sleeping rooms are located near the walking area. Sometimes a lot of noise.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic condo for the price!”
Reviews.Author: k79mill
Reviews.Content: This condo was fantastic! It was across the street from the ocean & within a short walking distance from 5th Ave. If you want a smaller more intimate area this is the place for you. Our concierge, Damion, was a huge help. Upon our arrival we were given a packet with 2 keys to the condo, a key to the safe & a prepaid cell phone that we could use while we were there. If we needed anything all we had to do was call Damion & he took care of all the details for us. We will definitely be going back again & we wouldn't stay anywhere else but The Elements.

Reviews.Title: “No hotel is perfect but The Elements gives it a good try”
Reviews.Author: jedbbb
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Playa del Carmen for a couple of months in 1995. Back then "5th avenue" was only a couple of blocks long. There were three areas of town - Playacar, Playa del Carmen, and del campo. If you wanted to stay in a hotel that was more than a place for beach bums to pass out you had to stay in Playacar. Oh sure, there were some nicer places close to the beach including some cool palapas down by the Blue Parrot (a name that means something totally different today) but Playa was not about luxury. Playa was about the beach, music all night, in a word - tranquillo. Tranquillo not because of opulence but because of the beauty of the air, sun, sand and laid back atmosphere and approach to life. Believe it or not, in the three months I lived there I spent less than a grand. Yesterday, my wife and I returned from a week at The Elements. This condo/hotel is as good as the new Playa has to offer. We stayed in Penthouse 19, a top floor condo with balconies off the living room and the bedrooms. Best of all is the rooftop patio with the hot tub. The view of the ocean from the rooftop is simply the best I have experienced in Playa. Even with all the development going on, there are only a few non-resorts this close to the beach. If you want a view, then The Elements is 5 stars. The Elements is also about luxury and modern refinement. As you can see from the hotel photos (which happen to be accurate), the structure is modern by design with glass, marble, granite everywhere. Think Taj Mahal (India, not Vegas). The furniture is also modern, which is code for spartan. While the furniture is the ultimate in hip, I can't say the couch was the most comfortable or that the bed was terribly soft. These are fairly minor points in my assessment, but when you are shooting as high as The Elements is trying to go, these are the kinds of details that some find important. The outdoor areas are well maintained and refined. The property is gated although the fence is more for definition than safety. The pool has a very unique design. A large portion of the pool is only 6 inches deep, a perfect place to lay in the pool chairs and soak up the sun. During our stay there were several families with smaller children that seemed to use the pool without pause all day and into the evening. It was also a good refuge from the blowing sand and rough surf left over from Alex, the tropical storm turned hurricane. The pool was also very clean, the staff spending several hours each day vacuuming it out and scrubbing it down. I'm more of a fan of Kool Beach Club at Mamitas Beach than sitting at the pool, but the families that stayed poolside certainly seemed to enjoy it. So, the one thing that is not clear from the other descriptions of The Elements is its location. It is not centrally located and is very much isolated. This is not necessarily a criticism but was a bit of a shock for us. This was our third trip to Playa since 2007 and we are very familiar with the town so getting around is no big deal. But if you want to go participate in the tourist tradition of walking down fifth avenue and getting accosted by shop owners who "want to ask you a question" and resturanteurs whose "mother works in the kitchen" then plan on walking at least 10 to 15 minutes to get to the newer north end of the avenue. If you are going to go get groceries at WalMart or Mega, then taking a cab is mandatory, at least on the way back to the hotel (50 pesos without a tip). While I have never had any safety issues in Playa, I don't think I would have walked back to the hotel at 2 or 3 in the morning if we had gone out to the clubs. While taxis are everywhere, some people have a lower tolerance for this sort of thing. It only takes five minutes to walk to the Oxxo, Mexico's version of QuickTrip or Seven-11, so buying convenience store type things (beer, cigarettes, pork rinds, coca cola) is not a challenge. The Elements has an arrangment with a resturant and you can call the concierge who will order the food for you. The service is quick and the food is very good, especially the breakfast. So the question neither my wife and I have been able to answer yet is whether we would have stayed at The Elements if we knew how far it was from everything. The answer is probably. It's not cheap. The flip side for us was we saved a bunch of money staying in and not partying all night at the disco's. Staying in required us to make a couple of trips to the grocery store for food and Oxxo for beer. The decision comes down to eye candy - the view of the ocean, the architecture, the manicured grounds. If this is what you like, this is the place to be. If you are interested in spending more time going out in the evening/night, look at the other Bric properties like Maya Villa with similar high end finishes. While the ocean view is not comparable, you can stumble back to the room when the fire dance ends. Being away from the crazyness of 5th avenue certainly made this trip much more relaxing than when we have stayed in the middle of things. Finally, Damian is the concierge and he is a wonderful asset. His English is excellent and he tells it like it is. His resturant suggestions were spot on. Also, there is a little Italian resturant two blocks away that is fantastic. The name is something like Pummarola. (Damian can correct me.) It appears less than impressive when you walk by but everything does because you just walked out of The Elements. But the food, service and prices are wonderful and with your first bite you feel as if you have stumbled on a real culinary find. I got the fish filette and had no idea that I would end up with a fantastic mix of clams, muscles, shrimp and fish. An absolutely wonderful meal. So that's the end. Playa del Carmen is not a sleepy fishing village any more. It is becoming more and more luxurious and The Elements is at the top end of this trend. Be prepared to walk but know you will be happy everytime you come back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Masarp
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location, gorgeous rooms and a huge pool!! Granted, being a stronger Spanish speaker would've helped in communicating with the staff, but they were always willing to help as best they could. We rented one of the 2 bed/2 bath penthouses and were not disappointed one bit. Very spacious with a huge balcony and rooftop all with direct oceanfront and pool views. The pool was cleaned everyday and was absolutely stunning. While the location is a little out of the main shopping/dining area, it's actually kind of nice if you want to be away from all the crowds but still within a good distance. Very nice and quiet property. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I will again be staying at Hotel Elements on my next trip to Playa!”
Reviews.Author: grace895
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in condos on vacation before I had certain expectatons of Hotel Elements. Those expectations were certainly surpassed! I absolutely loved it! My boyfriend and I booked for a quick get away and ended up loving Playa and the Elements so much we extended our vacation. The location was great, with a beautiful view of the water and a two minute walk to the beach club. I don't think I have ever stayed any place so clean. The condos were modern, large and exquisitely furnished. Huge rooms, tiled and glass floor to ceiling showers, dining room, beautiful breezy living room with a quiet patio where we had our coffee every morning. On site massage therapists, a fantastic staff. Great fitness room too. Easy beach walk to downtown Playa, or a 5 min taxi ride. We met some great families, as well as couples. We liked it because it was quiet and relaxed, yet close to everything. I felt very safe and will be bringing my children next time. With the spaciousness of the layout, it was indeed quiet...even though it seemed like the hotel was full. The beach club was my favorite place to eat and hang out, casual yet up-scale. Great music, awesome staff, fabulous food. We`met people from all over the world. I have told all my friends this is the place to go. Thank you so much Hotel Elements, for making our stay feel like a once in a life time vacation!

Reviews.Title: “PENTHOUSE KARMA...PERFECTION.”
Reviews.Author: TnTWalter
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Elements, Penthouse Karma. We booked through vrbo.com but enjoyed the benefit of a local management company NASPLAYA. The condo was immaculate, tastefully decorated and very well stocked. Everything you needed was available. The balconies had amazing views and plenty of seating including a dining table upstairs and the hot tub was heavenly. The beds were comfortable which is hard to find in Mexico. The pool was amazing. The maintenance workers kept the property in great shape. The beach area was pristine with plently of loungers and a couple of umbrellas for use. There is a bar next door Canibal Royal but it is pricey. We had drinks from our room [they even provide a cooler] or wandered south to a beach club if the mood hit. The location is as far north as you can go but nothing is very far in Playa. There are even some restaurants really close by....La Cueva del Chango is a must for breakfast or lunch. There's also 2 italian restaurants close by...Piola and Pummarola. Sadly we couldn't find Pummarola until the last day. Duh. But we enjoyed Piola. Taxis are about $50 pesos from the front desk...if you walk a little it's $30 pesos. We only used the taxi a couple of times as it was so easy to walk everywhere. We had a great time and I would definitely stay here again! Trish

Reviews.Title: “Elements 121”
Reviews.Author: debla1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 12 nights with our 11 month old baby at the Elements in Playa del Carmen, Unit 121. This was our first time staying at a condo and not at an all inclusive resort. The Elements definitely has a small resort like atmosphere. We had a GREAT time and we were very happy with the condo and the staff at the Elements. The sun hit our patio in the afternoons, so we could lay out while our daughter took her afternoon nap. The pool is really nice, I think it is one of the biggest in Playa. 5th Avenue is a 5 minute walk or short cab ride from the condo. Stephanie with Bric Rental was very nice and quick to help us book our condo. The conciere on duty was very helpful with getting taxi's or helping us find a place to eat. The maid cleaned our unit every day but Sunday when she was off duty. We used USA Transfers for the cab ride from the airport to the hotel. Susan with Latido de Mexico cooked us dinner in our condo one rainy night. It was really nice to have someone cook us dinner so we didn't have to go out in the rain with our daughter. Her mexican cheese dip was delicious! They have a babysitter available if you want a night out. We also got a couples massage on our patio when our daughter was taking a nap, $25 each. We took a taxi to Mega for our groceries. We later discovered a grocery store called Dak, it is a small grocery store and the produce looks better. One of our favorite places to eat was La Cueva del Chango, it's a five minute walk from the condo. La Cueva's food was all freshly prepared and the environment inside was unique. Overall-- the Elements was a great place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend the week!”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelmt
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a bit more space then the typical hotel room, condsider The Elements. The condos are modern, clean with a nice location for walking or short taxi ride to 5th Ave. nice beach and beautiful pool The concierge, Damien is to be commended for his never ending service to his guests, Even tracking down our daughters new dress purchase left in a restaurant on 5th Ave! Be assured if you choose The Elements you will be treated to an exceptional stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, beautiful room, view and professionals taking care of us”
Reviews.Author: Jessica113
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I traveled with 3 other families. Our trip was well coordinated with the bric rental associates. Once there we were met by Damien who gave us all the ins of the place and showed us the beautiful grounds and rooms. There were free massages with tip....the beach was directly in front of us and Damien coordinated all of the trips and dinner plans we had. There is a fantastic bar and restaurant right next door with fresh fish and wonderful drinks. We swam with the dolphins...caught a boat directly on the beach from our place for scuba and snorkeling....ate at an elegant restaurant that was in a cave and para sailed again right off the beach from our room...all we had to do is say we want to do this or that and Damian made it happen for us. It was a fantastic vacation and would recommend it to anyone who wants to live in an upscale room with out paying the 4 or 5 star price.

Reviews.Title: “Million-dollar view”
Reviews.Author: TONecie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from The Elements Penthouse #2 (Penthouse del Karma) Had a wonderfully relaxing week here! Lovely condo complex.Beautiful pool& private beach club. We spent most days waking up to watch the sunrise, while drinking coffee on the balcony. We would walk the beach, then head up to the private roof-top for the day. Went out for dinner & returned to the condo & back up to the roof with a bottle of champagne for the hot-tub. Watched the stars twinkling & the lights from Cozumel. Slept very well here, very quiet at night. A little piece of heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Elements is simply the best”
Reviews.Author: BenKap
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be more happy with our stay at the Elements. The condo complex is simply beautiful and the units are top notch. The staff were very helpful and went out of their way to make sure you have a great trip. One of the best things about ELements is that it's not too far from the middle of PDC but close enough that you can walk. So you get the benefit of being away from the noise but still close to all the restaurants etc. The beach club across the street (Canibal ROyal) is also highly recommended..We'll be back to the Elements soon...

Reviews.Title: “After the Playacar Palace. would we be happy in a condo?”
Reviews.Author: slyebob
Reviews.Content: The first week of our vacation was at the Playacar Palace which I have already reviewed. We then moved to the condo (Elements 224). When we first arrived we were met by Damian who ensured we knew everything about the complex. Unlimited bottled water, cell phone for local use which came in handy when I had left something at the first hotel and needed to talk to them, private Beach... It was the perfect start to our second vacation week. The condo was great and the 4 of us had enough room that we weren't falling over each other. The view of the Ocean from our balcony was fantastic and the beach chairs were fine. 50 beach chairs.....20 people...no reserving here. If one felt like like it there were a couple of ;adies offering free massages. I assume everyone tipped or at least hope so. The location was perfect as it wasa short walk to 5th Avenue. Stopped at a few great restaurants, bistros and eeven a sports bar to watch soccer and the olympics. The peopel at Bric realty who handle the rentals of this building couldn't have been nicer. Thanks Stepahanie and again Damian for your good work. Would I stay there again...Of course.... Maybe next time though we may even try something like the Bric Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Playa, the best of both worlds.”
Reviews.Author: grcboss
Reviews.Content: It has been 2 days since we returned from Playa. After dragging our luggage through 3 feet of snow over our unplowed street at 11:30 PM, reality set in. We had just left paradise. I promised a few people that I would write an honest review of The Elements, so here we go. We arrived to the condo (which is what it really) with no problem. I arranged a transfer with Entertainment Plus, which was $105 USD for roundtrip transportation. They were waiting for us at the airport and we had very nice English speaking drivers both ways. After a pleasant 30-40 minute ride we arrived at The Elements. Damien, the property concierge, was waiting for our arrival at the front desk. I really can’t say enough about him. He is fluent in French (my husband is French), Spanish, and English. We were shown to our condo, which was Penthouse 16. Don’t expect a bellman, The Elements isn’t like that. I’m not saying this in a bad way; someone will help you, for example Damien, a security guard from the condo, or even a guest if you need it. When we got into the apartment, Damien gave us our keys, showed us all of the electronic gadgets, and gave us a phone with his cell number, as well as the number for Bric, the management company already stored in it. He let us know that if there was anything we needed he was there for us. He ended up making all of our dinner reservations and transfer confirmations. As per his advise, every restaurant he recommended was excellent. The building is beautiful. From the time you arrive you feel as if you are standing in front of a modern Mayan structure. The grounds and pool area are immaculate, the caretakers work from sun up to sun down. The condo is huge to say the least (compared to a hotel room). We stayed in the master suite, with a giant bathroom and shower, and our kids shared a second bedroom with 2 full sized beds and used the hall bath with and shower. The décor is modern and sleek, the kitchen was perfect and had almost everything we needed. Views from our place were beautiful. The building is still fairly new and so there is not much wear and tear. There are many units, which haven’t been sold yet, so there haven’t been many guests. We went to the Mega (a local grocery store) to stock up on food for breakfast, lunch and snacks. You will need a few staples like plastic wrap, sugar, napkins, etc. We are not big eaters, which is why we prefer staying in an apartment and not an all-inclusive. We also like to get a feel for where we are staying, which made The Elements the perfect place for us. We were provided with plenty of towels but there is no service at the pool or beach. The maids (off on Sunday) do the laundry every other day and do a great job cleaning the apartment. It was nice having a washer and dryer in the unit. If you are looking for action The Elements isn’t for you. My husband and I spent a week; our kids were with us for 4 nights, our daughter (22) and our son (26). The arrangement was perfect for us because of the 2 bedrooms. The beach and pool are very quiet and relaxing. The Jacuzzi was an excellent way to end a rough day swimming and tanning. We met a few couples from Canada and a family with young children. However, the walk to 5th takes about 5-10 minutes, so you can be in the heart of Playa easily, if you want. Damian arranged to have women who give massages on the patio of one of the vacant garden units, this was one of the highlights of our trip, an hour massage in the warm Mexican breeze for about $25USD/hour. To the left of the condo is an adorable little beach club and restaurants called the Cannibal Royal, with good food, great music and fun for all of us. To the right of the condo is a small fishing house which seems to be a hangout for local fisherman who are very nice and don’t get in your way. Many locals visit the beaches in Playa so you will see a real mix. I must add, that this area of town is seeing a lot of construction, so I imagine that in a few years it will be more crowded. There was talk of getting a concession by the beach or pool to offer drinks and snacks as well as arranging for some umbrellas for the beach. This would be an added convenience, but with the cooler that Damien provided us with, keeping hydrated was not a problem for us! Finally, this is a flip-flop destination; leave your diamonds and Gucci’s at home. If you are looking for a fancy schmancy vacation, The Elements isn’t for you. Playa is a beach town, just like in the states but with an international twist! Just relax and enjoy. We are already planning our next trip! I want to thank Damien, Stephanie, and Andy!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous pristine ocean retreat”
Reviews.Author: tropicina
Reviews.Content: Recently, I read a review of the Elements in Playa del Carmen that talked about the electricity and power being shut off. I just spent a week in PH2 and it was so beautiful down there, and the complex is kept meticulously maintained. The pool man spends 3 hours every day cleaning the pool and the grounds are constantly groomed. Now the private beach club has been made...all the little huts that were there originally are now gone and the sand was sifted with a large sieve so that it is powdery and soft and clean. They are soon going to have comfortable lounge chairs, umbrellas, and maybe some things like kayaks for use by owners as well as guests..paid for by the owners in their monthly condo dues. There is an upscale seafood restaurant close by right on the beach that will be catering food and drinks to the beach club. I can't wait to go back when this is all ready, which sounds like it will be very, very soon! As far as the electricity and power being shut off, I heard that did happen which was inconvenient for the people who were there that week. That was resolved now, and was because the developers saw that minerals were starting to build up in all the pipes in the complex, especially in the pool pipes (water in Playa I guess is very hard). So they spent a lot of extra money installing a special ozone system to purify the water so that sludge would not destroy the pipes in the future. ..which was necessary and a good thing for owners in the long run. So I would add that this looks to be taken care of and was all done by the time we went down a few weeks ago. The place is definitely high class and so well designed and we will go there again because we had a great time! We were informed of this pipe thing while sitting at the pool by some owners who were there, as well as one of the developers who lives right there, so it was from a good source.
